newIncidents.title: Trump states intent to 'take over' elections amid Georgia records seizure dispute
newIncidents.description: President Trump publicly declared he wants to 'take over' elections as legal battles escalate over FBI seizure of Georgia voting records. The statement represents an unprecedented direct threat to election infrastructure independence. Source

newIncidents.title: Treasury Secretary suggests Trump could investigate Fed chair over policy disagreements
newIncidents.description: Treasury Secretary Bessent stated that Trump would decide whether to investigate Federal Reserve nominee Warsh if he refused to cut interest rates, directly threatening central bank independence from political interference. Source

newIncidents.title: Trump backs SAVE America Act to nationalize election administration
newIncidents.description: Trump endorsed federal legislation that would impose strict voter ID requirements and shift election control from states to federal oversight, fundamentally altering election infrastructure. Source

newIncidents.title: Senator refuses DOJ interview, alleges political intimidation
newIncidents.description: Sen. Slotkin publicly refused a DOJ interview request regarding a military video, stating 'the intimidation is the point' and signaling potential litigation over investigative tactics. Source

newCheckEvents.text: Trump publicly states he wants to 'take over' elections amid Georgia voting records seizure dispute. Source
FBI seizure of Georgia election records linked to conservative researcher raises questions about political motivation in election investigations. Source
Treasury Secretary Bessent states Trump would decide whether to investigate Federal Reserve chair over policy disagreements. Source

updates.summary: Added four critical incidents including Trump's stated intent to 'take over' elections, Treasury Secretary suggesting presidential investigations of Fed officials over policy disagreements, and a senator publicly refusing DOJ interview citing intimidation. Updated check events for Election Infrastructure, FBI Independence, and DOJ Independence with sourced developments.
